data.title: Fishing Horam Manor Farm Fishery Lakes
data.meta_description: Fishing review on Horam Manor Farm Fishery in Horam, East Sussex includes fishing lake details, photos, fishery prices, fish sizes and more.
data.text:
East Sussex -

Horam Manor Fishery

Horam Manor fishery is a nine water fishery located on the Horam Manor grounds just off the A267. The waters are spread across miles of secluded woods which team with woodland wildlife including a number of kingfishers. The complex offers a number of facilities to the visitor including tea rooms, toilets, car park, caravan/camping site, nature trails and museums. The majority of the lakes are set in the wooded areas of the complex. Nearly all of the waters are surrounded by numerous overhanging trees and bushes. The waters between them hold carp to 25lb, tench to 6lb, bream to 5lb, crucian carp to 1lb, roach and rudd to 1lb, perch to in excess of 3lb and the odd large eel to over 4lb. The water is open all year round.

fish species

Mirror Carp :

25lb Common Carp :

25lb Wild Carp:

3lb Tench: 4lb Eel: 4lb+ Rudd: 1lb+ Roach: 1lb+ Crucian Carp : 1lb Bream : 5lb Perch : 3lb+

fishing lakes (11 )

House Pond - a small, shallow, oval shaped pond situated next to the car park and cafe.

Nursery Pond

Great Pond - a small picturess, oval shaped 1 acre pond situated next to the car park and cafe.

Banky Fork - a small 1/2 acre pond situated in the centre of a heavily wooded area.

Long Water - a long 1/2 acre pond situated in the centre of a heavily wooded area.

Coney - a small 1/2 acre woodland pond situated in the middle of the complex.

Brook Pit - a small oval shaped pond that is approximately 1/4 in size.

Lagoon - a long, narrow 1 acre lake situated at the bottom of a field.

Clear Hedges - the largest lake on the complex offering 20 pegs.

Catch Pool - a small recently restored water that has numerous overhanging trees and bushes and reed beds.

Hemlcok

House Pond

The House Pond is a small, shallow, oval shaped pond that is approximately 1/4 acre in size. The pond is one of the first waters you come across when you reach the fishing car park. The water is surrounded by over hanging trees and bushes apart from the car park side of the pond where the swims are located. This water is suitable for disabled anglers. House Pond is a very shallow water with the deepest regions reaching appoximately 3 feet. Baits which work well on this water include maggots, luncheon meat, sweetcorn and bread.

Mirror Carp:

7lb Common Carp:

7lb Tench: 3lb Perch:

2lb Roach: 1lb Rudd: 1lb

Features: Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size: 1/4 acre

Lake Depth: 3ft

Swims: 4

Great Pond

Great Pond is small picturess, oval shaped, 1 acre pond. This water is very popular amongst fisherman due to the pond being located next to the car park, the cafe and the toilets. Great Pond is packed with features including lilly pads, reeds, weed beds, an island and a few overhanging trees and bushes. The ponds depths range from 3-5 feet. The water has approximately 10-12 swims that are generally slightly sloped grass banks. Pretty much any bait you care to use will work on this water including luncheon meat, sweetcorn, maggots, casters, lobworm, bread, dog biscuits and boilies.

Mirror Carp:

14lb Common Carp:

15lb Tench: 4lb Perch:

2lb Roach: 1lb Rudd: 1lb

Features: Lilly pads, Weed beds, Reeds, A few overhanging trees and bushes, Island

Lake Size: 1 acre

Lake Depth: 3-5ft

Swims: 10-12

Banky Fork Pond

Banky Fork is a small 1/2 acre pond situated in the centre of a heavily wooded area. Features on this water include a number of overhanging trees and bushes and reed beds. Banky Fork is one of the deeper waters on the Horam Manor complex with depths of upto 7 feet. There are approximately 5-6 dirt-based swims of which 3 are flat and the other 2-3 are on a slight slope. The fish in Banky Fork aren't too fussy, the carp enjoy luncheon meat, bread, dog biscuits and boilies and the match fish enjoy maggots, casters, lobworm, sweetcorn, luncheon meat and bread.

Mirror Carp:

12lb Common Carp:

12lb Tench: 3lb Perch:

3lb Roach: 1lb Rudd: 1lb

Features: Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size: 1/2 acre

Lake Depth: 7ft

Swims: 5-6

Long Water Pond

The Long Water is a long 1/2 acre pond situated in the centre of a heavily wooded area. Features on this water include a number of overhanging trees and bushes. Long Water is the deepest water on the Horam Manor complex with depths of upto 12 feet. There are approximately 5-6 banked swims. Long Water's carp enjoy luncheon meat, bread, dog biscuits and boilies and the match fish enjoy maggots, casters, lobworm, sweetcorn, luncheon meat and bread.

Mirror Carp:

10lb Common Carp:

10lb Tench: 3lb Perch:

3lb Roach: 1lb Rudd: 1lb Bream : 5lb

Features: Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size: 1/2 acre

Lake Depth: 12ft

Swims: 5-6

Coney Pond

The Coney is a small 1/2 acre woodland pond situated in the middle of the complex. The waters features include large reed beds and numerous overhanging trees and bushes. There are approximately 6-8 sloped swims. The waters depths range from 3-6 feet. Successful baits on this water include luncheon meat, sweetcorn, maggots, casters, lobworm and bread.

Mirror Carp:

20lb Common Carp:

20lb Tench: 4lb Perch: 4lb Roach: 1lb Rudd: 1lb

Features: Reeds, Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size: 1/2 acre

Lake Depth: 3-6ft

Swims: 6-8

Brook Pit Pond

Brook Pit is one of the smaller waters on the complex. The water is a small oval shaped pond that is approximately 1/4 in size. Brook pit has a scattering of overhanging trees and bushes and a small reed bed. The waters depths range from 3-7 feet. There are approximately 5 sloped banked swims. Successful baits on this water include luncheon meat, maggots, casters, lobworm and boilies.

Mirror Carp:

17lb Common Carp:

17lb Tench: 2lb Rudd: 1lb Roach: 1lb Perch: 2lb

Features: Reeds, Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size: 1/4 acre

Lake Depth: 3-7ft

Swims: 5

Lagoon Lake

The Lagoon is a long, narrow, 1 acre lake situated on the outskirts of the wood, located at the bottom of a field. The water has got reeds in the margins and a number of overhanging trees and bushes on the far bank. The Lagoon has depths ranging from 4-6 feet. There are approximately 6-8 swims that are flat grass banked pegs that are slightly raised from the waters edge. Baits that work well on the Lagoon include maggots, casters, lobworm, bread and boilies.

Mirror Carp:

25lb Common Carp:

25lb Rudd: 1lb Roach:1lb Tench: 4lb Perch: 4lb

Features: Reeds, Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size: 1 acre

Lake Depth: 4-6ft

Swims: 6-8-

Clear Hedges Lake

It is a long 15 minute trek to Clearhedges as it is one of the furhest waters from the fishing car park. Once you get there, the walk is worth it, with this peaceful, secluded lake that is packed with features which include lilly pads, reeds and many overhanging trees and bushes. Clearhedges is the largest lake on the complex offering 20 pegs.

Mirror Carp:

17lb Common Carp:

17lb Perch: 2lb Rudd: 1lb Roach: 1lb

Features: Lilly Pads, Reeds, Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size:

Lake Depth:

Swims: 20

Catch Pool

The Catch pool is a small recently restored water that has numerous overhanging trees and bushes and reed beds. The waters depths range from 3-6 feet.

Mirror Carp:

10lb Common Carp:

8lb Crucian Carp:

1lb Tench: 2lb Roach: 8oz Rudd: 8oz

Features: Reeds, Overhanging trees and bushes

Lake Size:

Lake Depth: 3-6ft

Swims:

ticket prices

Day Ticket : £5.00 per rod

Annual Day Ticket Membership: £80 (1 rod), £120 (2 rods)

24 hours: £20.00 Non members £10.00 members, by arrangement.

contact details

Contact: Graham Axell

Address: 28 Falcon Way, Hailsham, East Sussex, BN27 1HY

Telephone: 01323 840 889

Mobile: 07707 759364

Email: horammanorfishery@gmail.com

Website: www.horammanorfishery.com

directions

Horam Manor is located on the outskirts of Horam on the A267. If you are driving south through Horam then you will find the estate signposted on the right as you leave the village. Once on the complex follow the road past the caravan/camping site until you reach the fishing carp park which is situated between the tea rooms in front of you and a lake either side.

Horam Manor Fishery, Horam, East Sussex, TN21 0BJ
